newsitem.title: DUBAI: UAE raises retail diesel price on oil rally.
newsitem.headline: UAE raises retail diesel price on oil rally.

text.p: Diesel pump prices in OPEC member United Arab Emirates have been raised by 5.8 percent to adjust to surging world oil prices, UAE retailers said on Wednesday.

Diesel prices at the forecourt have risen to 3.60 dirhams (98 U.S. cents) a gallon from 3.40 dirhams as international prices near six-year highs due to low inventory levels and renewed tension in the Middle East.

"We had been maintaining the price level of 3.40 dirhams by absorbing the international price increases which cut into our margins. Even now there is an element of subsidisation in the price," Tayyeb Al Mulla, supply manager at distributor EPPCO, told the local Khaleej Times newspaper.
Gulf gas oil was assessed at around $28.40 a barrel on Wednesday, compared to $18.55 at this time last year.
Diesel retailed at 2.90 dirhams in December 1995.
